thread.title: Pink Calendar

author: DispatchDaemon
title: Pink Calendar
text:
Free Mammograms
Oct. 23. The Chatham County Health Department’s Breast and Cervical Cancer Program (BCCP) is partnering with the St. Joseph’s/Candler Mobile Mammography Program to offer free mammograms in honor of National Breast Cancer Awareness Month. Women 40-64 years old without insurance whose annual income is not greater than 200 percent of the Federal Poverty Level are eligible. Appointments are encouraged but walk-ins will be accepted. To make an appointment, call 819-6800. The event takes place Oct. 23 from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. at Chatham County Health Department, 1395 Eisenhower Drive.
Wendy’s Walk Every Step Counts at the Lighthouse
On Oct. 24 at 8:30 a.m. to noon, Wendy’s Walk, Every Step Counts, will take place at the raised cottage next to the Tybee Island Lighthouse. The walk is hosted by The Tybee Island Historical Society and aims to raise awareness for breast cancer.
Savannah Prom
Oct. 24. K & J Event Designers in conjunction with E93 and Magic 103.9, Cumulus Media Companies, will be hosting our first adult prom, “The Savannah Prom.” This event will be held Oct. 24 at the King Frazier Ballroom on the campus of Savannah State University. This charitable event supports Sisters Network and will recognize Cancers Survivors and Patients. Sister Network Inc. is the only National African American Breast Cancer Survivorship organization in the U.S. Tickets for this charitable event are on sale at Lester’s Florist at 2100 Bull St., and Luxe The Salon at 147 Montgomery Crossroad. If you cannot attend this event donations, will be gladly accepted, Contact K & J Event Designers at kjeventdesigners@gmail.com . All donations will go to the Sisters Network. For more detailed information contact us at: kjeventdesigners@gmail.com
A Day for Mammograms
Oct. 26. A Day for Mammograms is an annual event to get as many women mammograms as possible. Schedule a mammogram by calling 912-819-PINK. Locations include Telfair Pavilion, Candler Hospital, 5353 Reynolds St.; St. Joseph’s Hospital, 11705 Mercy Blvd.; Telfair Breast Imaging, 527 Eisenhower Drive; The Imaging Center, Belfair Towne Village East, 10-A Oak Forest Road, Bluffton; SJ/C Imaging — Pooler, 105 Grand Central Blvd., Suite 106. For more information, go to www.komencoastalgeorgia.org .
Spin-a-thon
Oct. 28. Anytime Fitness, Whitmarsh Island, 119 Charlotte Road, will host a spin-a-thon to raise funds for Barbell for Boobs, an organization to help women get mammograms. Starts at 8:30 am to 11:30 am. One hour time slots to Spin. $10 for one hour; $15 for two hours; $25 for three hours. Instructors will lead you in a fun, high energy cycle class. Cycle for an hour or more. Must reserve a bike. Bikes are limited. 912-897-1499. Open to members and non-members. All proceeds go to Wear PINK.
Apertivio Hour at Leoci’s
6 p.m. Oct. 29. Leoci’s Trattoria, 606 Abercorn St. Join Chef Roberto Leoci for free appetizers each Thursday in October. Leoci has been designated as one of this year’s Susan G. Komen BigWigs, and he will be wearing his bright pink wig and accepting donations. For more information, go to www.leocis.com.
Pink HealthFest
10 a.m. to 2 p.m. Oct. 31. Prince Hall Center, 602 E. Broad St. The Omar Court No. 91 Daughters of Isis will host the annual Lucille Crawford Think Pink HealthFest on Oct. 31. Entrance is free. Physician specialists will be on hand for female and male health discussions. Learn more at www.komencoastalgeorgia.org .
Cleaning Essentials Cleaning Service
Cleaning Essentials Cleaning Service will like to donate their services to Breast Cancer Patients for BreastCancer Awarenesss Month. For the month of October, Cleaning Essentials will be doing free 2.5 hour house cleaning services for anyone who are currently battling Breast Cancer or have fought their battle and overcame BreastCancer Cancer. In order to get your free 2.5 hour General Clean Service, you must email Cleaning Essentials at Cleaning_essentials@yahoo.com , send a pic of yourself and tell them a little about your story. Once your email is receive they will give you a call to set up your appointment. They are only taking up to 15 Clients for the month of October. You can also recommend services for someone else that you may know. If you have any questions please call Ms. Kaleen at 912-428-9655.
